        <title><![CDATA[Special Operations Forces (SOF) Technical Writer/Training Developer/Instructor]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[   
  
  Special Operations Forces (SOF) Technical Writer/Training Developer/Instructor  
  
 
  
 Location  Fort Bragg, NC  
  
 
  
 Job Code  2001  
  
 
  
 # of openings  1  
  
 
  
 
  
 Apply Now (https://phf.tbe.taleo.net/phf01/ats/careers/v2/applyRequisition?org=PFS&cws=40&rid=2001)  
  

  

  

  
 
  
  Special Operations Forces (SOF) Technical Writer / Training Developer / Instructor  
  
 
  
 Location: Ft. Bragg, NC 
  
 
  
 Employment Class:  Full Time Regular 
  
 
  
  Clearance:   Secret Level Security Clearance 
  
 
  
 1 Prospect Technologies, LLC is seeking qualified candidates to provide Special Operations Forces (SOF) Medical Instruction and Instructional Writing Support Services at Fort Bragg, NC. 
  
 
  
 Essential Duties and Responsibilities: 
  
 
  
 
  
+  Use teaching methods for large group classroom instruction, small group instruction, and hands-on training in coordination with Subject Matter Expert (SME) 
  
 
  
+  Coordinate classes and prepare lesson plans to include developing and implementing practical exercises and learning activities 
  
 
  
+  Assemble and maintain materials to include lesson plans, visitor’s folder, etc. 
  
 
  
+  Manage and monitor the institutional programs 
  
 
  
+  Analyze, design, create, implement, and evaluate lesson products to include lesson plans, lectures, demonstrations, practical exercises, supplemental handouts, videos, homework assignments, grade sheets, and exam questions 
  
 
  
+  Produce curriculum that is accurate, relevant, and synchronized with force requirements that fosters critical thinking and problem-solving skills 
  
 
  
+  Incorporate deliberate strategies to ensure required graduate skill levels, knowledge, and abilities transfer from the institutional environment to the operational environment 
  
 
  
+  Update and rewrite lesson products as required by changes in doctrine and curriculum development 
  
 
  
+  Support daily operations to include all instruction and hands on application thru practical exercise with various tools for medical instruction 
  
 
  
+  Maintain, update, proofread and recommend changes to program lessons plans to include class content 
  
 
  
+  Advise on development and implementation of course material 
  
 
  
+  Provide expertise for planning and executing future classes and exercises and provide recommendations for final approval 
  
 
  
+  Provide input on doctrine development and changes, and curriculum updates 
  
 
  
+  Conduct preventive maintenance checks and services on equipment and systems 
  
 
  
+  Identify and report any training/system deficiencies that may have impact on the ability to accomplish training objectives 
  
 
  
+  Design/create electronic aids is support of training objectives 
  
 
  
+  Create tables/maintain data and query system 
  
 
  
+  Develop educational and command slide presentations 
  
 
  
+  Perform database/statistics compilation and analysis 
  
 
  
+  Manage educational program administrative requirements 
  
 
  
+  Other duties as assigned 
  
 
  
 
  
 Minimum Qualifications: 
  
 
  
 
  
+  Prior Military Experience 
  
 
  
+  Three (3) years of emergency medical instruction 
  
 
  
+  One (1) year of experience as a United States Navy Independent Duty Corpsman (IDC); or United States Army Special Forces Medical Sergeant (SOFMS) or a Special Operations Combat Medic (SOCM); or as an instructor in an USSOCOM medical pipeline course 
  
 
  
+  Knowledge and ability to provide training in the areas of anatomy, physiology, basic physical exams, medical patient assessment, medical documentation, combat casualty care, pre-hospital trauma emergencies and care, Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS), Pediatric Education for Prehospital Providers (PEPP, Basic Life Support (BLS), and Pre-Hospital Trauma Life Support (PHTLS). 
  
 
  
+  United States Army Small Group Instructor Training Course (provided by Government), or Instructor Training Couse (ITC) 
  
 
  
+  Ability to work effectively in an austere field training environment for up to 12 hours conducting up to five (5) cross country movements per day, 400 meters each 
  
 
  
+  Certifications/Courses: 
  
 
  
+  American Academy of Pediatricians (AAP) PEPP Instructor 
  
 
  
+  American Heart Association (AHA) BLS Instructor 
  
 
  
+  American Heart Association (AHA) ACLS Instructor (must be obtained within 6 weeks of hire) 
  
 
  
+  National Registry of Emergency Medical Technicians (NREMT) Paramedic (NRP) (Active) Certification; or United States Special Operations Command (USSOCOM) Advanced Tactical Paramedic (ATP) (Active) Certification 
  
 
  
+  United States Army Small Group Instructor Training Course (provided by Government), or Instructor Training Course (ITC) 
  
 
  
+  Curriculum Development Course (CDC-provided by Government) 
  
 
  
+  IAT Level I (A+, Network+) 
  
 
  
 
  
 
  
+  Computer skills: 
  
 
  
+  Expertise with Microsoft Windows OS XP Pro, Word, Power Point, and Excel without further training 
  
 
  
+  Ability to operate common office equipment and perform administrative office duties 
  
 
  
 
  
 
  
+  May require some travel and after-hours support 
  
 
  
+  Excellent verbal and written communication 
  
 
  
+  Must be able to stand for long periods of time instructing 
  
 
  
+  Ability to utilize fine motor skills 
  
 
  
+  Secret Level Security Clearance 
  
 
  
 
  
 Additional Qualifications:  
  
 
  
 
  
+  Candidates teaching the NREMT Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) and Paramedic (P) courses, and cardiopulmonary resuscitation must be a United States Army Special Forces Medical Sergeant (SOFMS) (MOS18D) or United States Navy Special Operations Independent Duty Corpsman (SOIDC) graduate 
  
 
  
+  Candidates selected as the Contract Manager (CM) or Assistant Contract Manager (ACM) must possess the following: 
  
 
  
+  Bachelor’s degree (10 years United States Army Special Operations Forces (SOF) experience may substitute for academic degree) 
  
 
  
+  Experience working with senior military officers and at a minimum, experience commensurate to that of a senior Non-Commissioned Officer (NCO) of the pay grade of E8 
  
 
  
+  Four (4) years’ experience of senior level supervision, management and operation of Mission Command Training Center/Complex, with emphasis on SOF 
  
 
  
+  Project Management Professional Certification. Experience may substitute for certification 
  
 
  
 
  
 Additional Desired Qualifications/Experience: 
  
 
  
 
  
+  At least eight (8) years of experience at Special Forces Group (SFG) or higher United States Army or Joint Special Operations organizations 
  
 
  
+  Experience with Special Warfare Center & School (SWCS) Training Management System. 
  
 
  
 
  
 1 Prospect Technologies, LLC is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.
